e stuck above the pelvic brim.
• It is more common with babies of diabetic mothers and other large babies but is unpredictable.
• Emergency management is as follows:
o call for at least two assistants
o explain the problem to the woman
o immediately move the woman to the edge or to the lower end of the delivery bed
o help the woman to hyper flex the hip joints (McRoberts’ position). Her knees should almost touch her
shoulders
o apply suprapubic pressure. Do not apply fundal pressure
o tell the w
